The Saige Community Food will be delivery-only after May 8th. You must sign up through the link below, and confirmation calls will be made the day of delivery. 
https://tinyurl.com/SaigeDelivery

QMUNITY’s offices remain closed until further notice. They have taken the necessary measures to protect the health of their staff, community members, and people accessing their spaces. For more information visit their COVID-19 page.
es: Las oficinas de QMUNITY permanecen cerradas hasta nuevo aviso. Han tomado las medidas necesarias para proteger la salud de su personal, miembres de la comunidad y personas que acceden a sus espacios. Para obtener más información, visita su página COVID-19.

en: For information on COVID-19 news, visit their website: www.rainbowrefugee.com/news

The Trans Specialty Care Program remains open at this time and continuing to see both new and existing clients. To support continued social distancing efforts, clients are primarily being seen through virtual care (Zoom) or by telephone. In-person visits will be considered on a case-by-case basis. If you are a NEW client, please fill in the form below, and the program will be in touch with you as soon as possible.
http://www.vch.ca/Pages/Contact-the-Trans-Specialty-Care-Program.aspx?res_id=1342
VAST staff are available during COVID-19, reach out to them or book an appointment online if you want to set up a time to talk.

Take your pick - video conferencing, email, text messaging or phone. These are the choice communication tools ISSofBC Settlement Orientation Services (SOS) staff are using to ensure refugee claimant clients in Metro Vancouver are fully supported during this unprecedented time. If you are a refugee claimant, they can assist you with accessing social assistance such as the recent Canadian Emergency Response Benefit, food banks, health services, trauma supports and much more.
Get in touch with them to learn how they can help. Email: sosreception@sosbc.ca. Phone: 604-255-1881. Website: https://issbc.org/our-services/sos-settlement-orientation-services

During COVID-19, the Centre continues to be open for urgent appointments, limited STI testing and treatment services, priority drop-in and other scaled back services. See their website for details by program/service (https://ninecircles.ca/news-events/covid-19/). They are screening all clients and staff entering the building for symptoms of COVID-19, and access to the building is through the rear door only (from the parking lot).
They will limit the number of people waiting to be screened inside the building so you may be asked to wait outside, and they recommend the use of a face covering. If you are not sure if you should come down or not, call them first.
Due to COVID-19, HIAS' offices around the globe have turned to technology (mobile devices, chat apps) & other tools to deliver life saving help to their clients.
es: Debido a COVID-19, las oficinas de HIAS en todo el mundo han recurrido a la tecnología (dispositivos móviles, aplicaciones de chat) y otras herramientas para brindar ayuda que salve vidas a sus clientes.

en: Transgender Gender-Variant & Intersex Project is currently offering emergency COVID-19 housing. Please contact TGIJP for more information.
es: Transgender Gender-Variant & Intersex Project ofrece alojamiento de emergencia de COVID-19 actualmente. Por favor contacta con TGIJP para más información.

en: PHR serves as a way to connect attorneys to health professionals who can provide psychological and physical evaluations for clients. If you are an attorney seeking a forensic evaluation for your client, please fill out the request form and submit it at least 12 weeks before the affidavit is required.

Due to the pandemic, the Callen-Lorde Community Health Center is offering some services in person and some virtually through scheduled appointments. Check their website for more detailed information: https://callen-lorde.org/covid-19-service-changes/.
es: Debido a la pandemia, el Centro de Salud Comunitario Callen-Lorde esta ofreciendo algunos servicios en persona y otros virtualmente a través de citas programadas. Visita su pagina web para obtener más información detallada:  https://callen-lorde.org/covid-19-service-changes/.

en: GMHC is delivering most services remotely at this time (except where indicated). The Testing Center is now open on Mondays and Tuesdays by appointment only. Our administrative offices are open on Wednesdays to clients by appointment only and for our Grab ‘n’ Go meals distribution program.
es: Debido a la pandemia COVID-19, GMHC esta emitiendo la mayoría de sus servicios remotamente en estos momentos (Excepto donde es indicado). El centro de pruebas ahora esta abierto los lunes y martes solo por cita. Nuestra oficina administrativas ahora están abiertas los miércoles para clientes solo por cita y solo para nuestro programa de distribución de alimentos “Grab ’n’ Go”.

en: Apicha CHC is currently accepting in-person appointments and offers video visits. To schedule either, please call 212-334-6029. For more information on how Apicha CHC is changing its services due to COVID-19, please visit https://www.apicha.org/en/services-covid19.
es: Actualmente Apicha CHC acepta citas en persona y ofrece visitas virtuales. Para fijar cualquiera de los dos, por favor llama a 212-334-6029. Para más información sobre cómo Apicha CHC cambia sus servicios debido a COVID-19, por favor visita https://www.apicha.org/en/services-covid19.

en: The 519 is open seven days a week with the exception of statutory holidays. They are located half a block north of the Church and Wellesley intersection, on the east side of the street. The 519 is an accessible facility with a ramp, elevator, and all-gender washrooms. For resources and information about services, supports, and care during COVID-19, please visit: https://www.the519.org/covid19resources

In response to COVID-19, the LGBTQ+ Refugee Programs are online and in person. If you’ve been waiting to register with the programs, you can do so by signing up for one of their free online Orientation Sessions on their website: www.mcctoronto.com

Due to the evolving COVID-19 situation, Weill Cornell Medicine is prohibiting medical students from being physically present at WCCHR evaluations. Our clinicians face similar restrictions in seeing patients for non-essential purposes in their practices. As such, we will not be scheduling in-person evaluations until further notice.

In order to continue serving the asylum community during this difficult time, we are offering the option of remote mental health evaluations via Zoom. Though tele-evaluations are not conducted regularly, many of our clinicians have experience conducting telemedicine visits. Physicians for Human Rights (PHR) is sharing best practices for conducting tele-evaluations with asylum clinics nationwide to ensure that we provide the best care possible to asylum seekers. 

Please do not hesitate to reach out to wcchr@med.cornell.edu with any questions or concerns.
es:
Debido a la evolución de la situación del COVID-19, Weill Cornell Medicine prohíbe a los estudiantes de medicina estar físicamente presentes en las evaluaciones del WCCHR. Nuestros médicos se enfrentan a restricciones similares para ver a los pacientes con fines no esenciales en sus prácticas. Por ello, no programaremos evaluaciones en persona hasta nuevo aviso.

Con el fin de continuar sirviendo a la comunidad de asilo durante este tiempo difícil, estamos ofreciendo la opción de evaluaciones de salud mental a distancia a través de Zoom. Aunque las tele-evaluaciones no se llevan a cabo con regularidad, muchos de nuestros médicos tienen experiencia en la realización de visitas de telemedicina. Physicians for Human Rights (PHR) está compartiendo las mejores prácticas para llevar a cabo tele-evaluaciones con las clínicas de asilo en todo el país para asegurar que proporcionamos la mejor atención posible a los solicitantes de asilo. 

No dude en ponerse en contacto con wcchr@med.cornell.edu si tiene alguna pregunta o duda.

en: The Door’s physical spaces are back open but also offer virtual resources in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. The health and wellbeing of their community is their top priority, and they are working hard to stay connected and to continue to support their members.
es: Los espacios físicos de The Door están nuevamente abiertos pero también ofrecen recursos virtuales en respuesta a la pandemia de COVID-19. La salud y el bienestar de su comunidad es su principal prioridad, y están trabajando arduamente para mantenerse conectades y continuar apoyando a sus miembres.

en: Appointments are available via video conference or phone.
es: Las citas están disponibles por vídeo conferencia o por teléfono.

en: All Legal Aid NL offices are serving clients remotely. All offices are closed to the public, no in-person meetings will be scheduled until further notice. Phones, mail, and faxes are operational and being monitored regularly.
Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, please call the centers to confirm hours. Some centers may have adjusted hours of operation.
es: Debido a la pandemia de COVID-19, llame a los centros para confirmar el horario. Algunos centros pueden tener horarios de operación ajustados.

en: The Legal Aid Society is committed to continuing to serving their clients during the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. Some business may be conducted remotely.

As of October 31, 2022, TASSC is no longer providing Case
Management or Counseling services currently. TASSC remains open for legal and career development services and the TASSC office is still available for survivors to gather and receive information on resources.
es: A partir del 31 de octubre de 2022, TASSC ya no proporciona casos, servicios de gestión o asesoramiento actualmente. TASSC permanece abierto para servicios legales y de desarrollo profesional y la oficina de TASSC aún está disponible para que les sobrevivientes se reúnan y reciban información sobre recursos.

en: Calls will be answered in person from 3:30 PM - 4:30 PM, Monday to Friday. At other times, callers can leave a message and someone from the Immigration Legal Program will call them back. The hotline number is 212-870-1179. Only general inquiries – not specific legal advice – will be answered on the hotline. Please continue to refer those with questions regarding their specific cases to LSSNY’s Immigration Legal Program at 212-265-1826 ext. 3013.
es: Las llamadas se atenderán personalmente de 15:30 a 16:30 horas, de lunes a viernes. En otros momentos, las personas que llaman pueden dejar un mensaje y alguien del Programa Legal de Inmigración les devolverá la llamada. El número de la línea directa es 212-870-1179. Solo consultas generales, no asesoramiento legal específico, serán respondidas en la línea directa. Continúe refiriendo a aquellos que tengan preguntas sobre sus casos específicos al Programa Legal de Inmigración de LSSNY al 212-265-1826 ext. 3013.

en:
Legal Services NYC’s offices are closed to the public due to the Coronavirus, but their dedicated staff is still working remotely to get justice for
new and existing clients. Existing clients should contact their advocate's office or extension for more on their cases. If you are seeking help with a new legal issue, call their Access Line at 917-661-4500 Monday through Friday from 9:30am to 4pm. For Brooklyn Legal Services, contact 718-237-5500. For Bronx Legal Services, contact 718-928-3700. For Manhattan Legal Services, contact 646-442-3100. For Queens Legal Services, contact 347-592-2200. For Staten Island Legal Services, contact 718-233-6480.
es: Las oficinas de servicios legales en Nueva York están cerradas para el público debido a coronavirus, pero el personal dedicado sigue trabajando remotamente para obtener justicia. Los clientes actuales deben ponerse en contacto con la oficina o la extensión de su defensor para obtener más información sobre sus casos. Si busca ayuda con un nuevo asunto legal, llame a su línea de acceso al 917-661-4500 de lunes a viernes de 9:30 a 16:00. Para los Servicios Legales de Brooklyn, llame al 718-237-5500. Para los Servicios Legales del Bronx, llame al 718-928-3700. Para los Servicios Legales de Manhattan, llame al 646-442-3100. Para los Servicios Legales de Queens, contacte con el 347-592-2200. Para los Servicios Legales de Staten Island, contacte con el 718-233-6480.

en:
Effective Monday, March 21st, 2022: MRNY offices are open for limited walk-ins. Please visit them or call a MRNY hotline in your area, and they'll do their best to help answer any questions: Bushwick, Brooklyn – (718) 418-7690 (Monday – Thursday: 10:00 AM – 1:30 PM and 2:30 PM – 6:00 PM) | Jackson Heights, Queens – (718) 565-8500 (Monday, Thursday & Friday: 10:30 AM – 1:30 PM and 2:30 PM – 6:30 PM, Wednesday: 2:30 PM – 6:30 PM) | Port Richmond, Staten Island – (718) 727-1222 (Monday – Thursday: 9:30 AM -1:30 PM and 2:00 PM – 6:00 PM) | Brentwood, Long Island – (631) 231-2220 (Monday – Thursday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 PM and 2:00 PM – 6:30 PM) | White Plains, Westchester – (914) 948-8466 (Monday – Thursday: 10:00 AM – 1:30 PM and 2:30 PM – 6:00 PM) | You can access their website for updates: https://maketheroadny.org/coronavirus/

Food pantries remain in service by appointment only. In order to make an appointment, call 866-365-2724 ext. 333 and leave a message.
es:
A partir del lunes 21 de marzo de 2022: las oficinas de MRNY están abiertas para visitas limitadas. Por favor, visítelos o llame a la línea directa de MRNY en su área, y ellos harán todo lo posible para ayudar a responder cualquier pregunta: Bushwick, Brooklyn - (718) 418-7690 (lunes - jueves: 10:00 AM - 1:30 PM y 2:30 PM - 6:00 PM) | Jackson Heights, Queens - (718) 565-8500 (lunes, jueves y viernes: 10:30 AM - 1:30 PM y 2:30 PM - 6:30 PM, miércoles: 2:30 PM - 6:30 PM) | Port Richmond, Staten Island - (718) 727-1222 (lunes - jueves: 9:30 AM -1:30 PM y 2:00 PM - 6:00 PM) | Brentwood, Long Island - (631) 231-2220 (lunes - jueves: 10:00 AM - 1:00 PM y 2: 00 PM - 6:30 PM) | White Plains, Westchester - (914) 948-8466 (lunes - jueves: 10:00 AM - 1:30 PM y 2:30 PM - 6:00 PM) | Puede acceder a su sitio web para las actualizaciones: https://maketheroadny. org/coronavirus/

Las despensas de alimentos permanecen en servicio sólo con cita previa. Para concertar una cita, llame al 866-365-2724 ext. 333 y deje un mensaje.

en: In light of ongoing developments around COVID-19, many emergency food providers in their network have temporarily suspended normal operations. The sites listed in the map at this link (https://www.foodbanknyc.org/get-help/) have switched to “grab and go” meals and pantry bags to minimize the risk of exposure. This list is subject to change without notice. They encourage calling ahead to confirm services and hours.
es: Debido a los cambios continuos de COVID-19, varios proveedores de comida de emergencia en su sistema han suspendidos temporalmente sus operaciones. Los sitios listados en el map en este enlace (https://www.foodbanknyc.org/get-help/) han transicionando a un sistema “grab and go” de comida y bolsas de despensa para reducir el riesgo de exposición. La lista está sujeta a cambios sin previo aviso. Ellos recomiendan llamar con anticipación para confirmar servicios y horarios.

en: Face masks are required indoors at all times.
es: Se requieren máscaras faciales en el interior en todo momento.

en: Northern Virginia Family Service is not currently accepting new clients into the Immigration Legal Services program and is not scheduling consultations at this time. This will not impact clients with an active Immigration Legal case.
es: Northern Virginia Family Service actualmente no está aceptando nueves clientes en el programa de Servicios Legales de Inmigración y no está programando consultas en este momento. Esto no afectará a les clientes con un caso legal de inmigración activo.

en:
Due to the surge in COVID cases and staffing shortages, La Clínica is providing limited services on site and via telehealth at this time. Their call volume is high at this time, they kindly ask, if you are returning a call regarding your appointment please call 202-462-4788, press 1, if there is no response, leave a message detailing your name, date of birth and phone number. Their team will call you back as soon as possible. They thank you for your patience and apologize for any inconvenience as they continue to protect their staff, patients, and community.

If you are a patient of La Clínica's please also call them before coming to the clinic - DC 202-462-4788 or MD 240-714-5247 - They can assist you and resolve many of your needs by telephone. Note, if they do not answer right away, please leave them a message or call back.
Please see official scholarship website for application deadlines
es: Por favor, consulte el sitio web oficial de becas para conocer los plazos de solicitud

en: Due to Covid-19, HeyDenver has limited availability. They are seeing clients by appointment only. Please do not bring a guest to an appointment, due to Covid they will be asked to wait outside.

All employees and visitors will be screened for illness prior to entering CHN offices.  Masks or face covering are required.  Enhanced safety protocols are in place to support social distancing following CDC recommendations.
es: Todos los empleados y visitantes serán examinados para detectar enfermedades antes de ingresar a las oficinas de CHN. Se requieren máscaras o cubiertas faciales. Se implementaron protocolos de seguridad mejorados para apoyar el distanciamiento social siguiendo las recomendaciones de los CDC.

en: They are still meeting with clients in the midst of COVID-19.
es: Todavía se están reuniendo con clientes en medio de COVID-19.

en: Due to COVID-19, they are continuing to limit in-person services and ask that all patients call their primary CHCB location to be triaged before coming in. Walk-in services are unavailable until further notice.
es: Debido a la COVID-19, continúan limitando los servicios en persona y solicitan que todes les pacientes llamen a su ubicación principal de CHCB para ser evaluades antes de ingresar. Los servicios sin cita previa no están disponibles hasta nuevo aviso.

en: They're currently open and have drop-in hours. Please consult their website for more information.

The Rainbow Resource Centre is open to the public. Their front doors are open during regular hours, which are listed on their website. Social / support groups will remain online on Zoom until further notice, and the Library will remain closed until further notice. If you have any questions about the status of their programs or services, please do not hesitate to contact them.

Their office is currently closed to the public until further notice due to COVID-19. Peer support services are currently being offered primarily by phone, video chat, and text-based messaging.  On an as-needed basis, they are also happy to meet with you in person by appointment. Please reach out so you can connect in the way that works best for you!

​

For more information on peer support services, please contact them at 403-234-8973 or info@calgaryoutlink.ca
All services are online during the pandemic. To access online services, click on the following link: https://calgaryunitarians.ca/sundayservices/online-services/
During COVID-19, HIV Edmonton will be providing services via phone and email. Their office remains closed for face to face meetings until further notice as directed by public health officials.
Northern Mosaic Network has created a new virtual calendar. Five days a week they have new and modified programs for youth, parents and families. Check their Facebook page for virtual programming.

Due to COVID-related concerns, please do not go to the office without an appointment. Call them and leave a voice message, send a text message or WhatsApp, from Monday to Thursday from 10 am until 4 pm. Messages will be listened to daily. The fastest way to reach them is by email (soutien.support@agirmontreal.org).

Province-wide phone lines for COVID-19: HealthLink BC is playing a significant role in supporting the public and has a FAQ about the coronavirus. If you have questions you can call 811 toll-free in BC, or for the deaf and hard of hearing, call 7-1-1. Translation services are available in more than 130 languages. Ministry of Health has created a phone service to provide non-medical information about COVID-19, including the latest information on travel recommendations and social distancing. Information is available in more than 110 languages, 7:30 am – 8 pm daily. BC Coronavirus Information Line: 1-888-COVID19 (1-888-268-4319) or via text message at 604-630-0300.  A new national toll-free information line is providing up-to-date information on COVID-19. Interpretation service is available in multiple languages, 7 am to 12 am daily. Coronavirus (COVID-19) Information Service: 1-833-784-4397.
***Need to confirm LGBTQ+ Affirming***
es: ***Es necesario confirmar la afirmación LGBTQ+***

en: The Youth Project is offering most services and programming virtually. Check their website for updates. If you have any questions regarding programming reach out to skye@youthproject.ns.ca.
They encourage you to first connect with them through Central Intake at 416-323-9149 ext. 234 or online at www.schliferclinic.com/intake

They have a COVID-19 response team that helps clients work towards their goals for surviving and thriving during the pandemic through virtual individual and group support. Included is support for social isolation, housing, mental health and addictions, and finding culturally appropriate community resources. For more information email info@riverdalehub.ca

To protect clients and employees from the spread of the coronavirus (COVID-19), Legal Aid BC is providing phone-only services. To apply for legal aid, contact them at 604-408-2172 or 1-866-577-2525. Or, if you live in a community where there is a local agent, call the agent's office to apply for legal aid. See Service locations for contact information.
The Parkdale Site is closed on Wednesdays from 9:00-13:00 for administration and meetings.

The Centre facilitates in-person primary care and mental health visits. On occasion, clients may use virtual appointments when they are accessible and work with their particular concerns.

If you feel ill or have any symptoms of a respiratory virus (fever, cough or shortness of breath), please let the screeners at the front know, and wear a mask and sanitize your hands when entering Sherbourne Health. You may also want to consider taking a COVID-19 rapid antigen test at home, and letting your provider know if you test positive for COVID-19 prior to coming onsite.

All service users coming to the centre will be screened for respiratory illness symptoms and will be asked to wear a mask and wait in a separate room if they screen positive for potential respiratory illness and/or COVID-19.

Their office is open to the public on a by-appointment basis. A mask or appropriate facial covering is required to enter the building. If you do not have a mask, they will provide you with one. The staff person will ask you a series of screening questions.

They are experiencing extreme numbers of appointment requests and call volumes and are unable to meet demand. Their lab is unable to process STI swabs and urine tests (chlamydia, gonorrhea, HSV), unless you are pregnant. This does not impact STBBI (HIV, Hep B, Hep C, syphilis) tests or Pap testing. The Victoria General STI clinic remains open at this time and will also be using risk assessments. Please do not bring any support people with you to appointments, and masks are required at appointments. Updates are posted on their social media and website.
See the following website for updated information on their COVID 19 policy: http://www.lgbtq2centre.com/covid-19-policies.html
Due to the pandemic, several of their services are being offered virtually. Check their social media (https://www.facebook.com/ensemblemoncton/?ref=page_internal) and website for updates.

The Kinbrace community is adapting and responding proactively to the COVID-19 threat. While maintaining a spirit of welcome and belonging, they are physically distancing from one another in the community and staff are running programs remotely to protect one another from COVID-19. Check their website for updates.
To access these resources during the COVID-19 pandemic please reach out to set-up an individual appointment with our team.
es: Para acceder a estos recursos durante la pandemia de COVID-19, comunícate para programar una cita individual con nuestro equipo.

en: The Pride Centre of Edmonton will continue to provide support to vulnerable community members through phone-based support, information and referral services, and engaging with community members focusing on how we can best meet their needs. Due to COVID-19, they are available for information and referral services by phone and appointment only on Tuesdays and Thursdays from 12-6:45 pm.

The firm is open for business during COVID-19. Consultations and client appointments may be booked by phone, Zoom, or Skype. For their mutual safety, in-person meetings and walk-ins are currently suspended until further notice. Their reception is open for socially-distanced drop-offs between 9:00 am – 5:00 pm Monday - Friday. To schedule an appointment call: 647-930-1518.

Due to COVID-19 concerns, the Centre won’t be offering in-person services until further notice. Counselling appointments are available over phone or Skype. Legal appointments are only available via Skype video call, and you will need to show current government-issued photo ID. Note they are unable to handle notarizing at this time (including name change documents).

Drop-in counselling is available at The Family Centre location Monday to Friday from 10 AM to 3 PM. Counselling is also available over the phone and video calls. Send an email to therapy-leads@familycentre.org or call 780.423.2831 to let them know that you would like to have a phone counselling session with a mental health therapist.
The Immigration Law Clinic is currently open and providing services with precautions in place to combat the spread of COVID-19. Contact their office for more information.
es: La Clínica de Derecho de Inmigración está actualmente abierta y brinda servicios con precauciones para combatir la propagación de COVID-19. Pónte en contacto con su oficina para obtener más información.

en: The team at CCC is actively monitoring the serious risks related to coronavirus. They will remain open and continue providing the critical services that their clients rely on. The staff is taking numerous precautions to protect themselves and their clients. They also ask that clients, volunteers, and guests follow the recommended precautions and risk-assessment guidelines from the CDC. Whenever possible and appropriate, clients are encouraged to access services by phone for ongoing case management services.
es: El equipo de CCC está monitoreando activamente los riesgos graves relacionados con el coronavirus. Permanecerán abiertos y continuarán brindando los servicios críticos en los que confían sus clientes. El personal está tomando numerosas precauciones para protegerse a sí mismes y a sus clientes. También piden que les clientes, voluntaries e invitades sigan las precauciones recomendadas y las pautas de evaluación de riesgos de los CDC. Siempre que sea posible y apropiado, se alienta a les clientes a acceder a los servicios por teléfono para los servicios de administración de casos en curso.

en:
Bette D. Harris Family & Child Clinic at Northwestern University Family Institute is currently scheduling new appointments via teletherapy, due to COVID-19.
Due to increased demand, they are experiencing longer than usual response times. Thank you for your patience.
es:
Clínica Bette D. Harris Family & Child en el Instituto Familiar de la Universidad Northwestern actualmente está programando nuevas citas a través de teleterapia, debido a COVID-19.
Debido al aumento de la demanda, están experimentando tiempos de respuesta más largos de lo habitual. Gracias por su paciencia.

en:
In-person assessments are closed due to COVID-19. Please apply over the phone.
During this challenging time and as the courts are re-opening, their Contact Centre is currently experiencing excessive call volumes and callers may experience longer wait times than usual. If you have had difficulty reaching them, please call back and stay on the line. They are working diligently to answer your calls.
The Centre is open. Call for an appointment 519-432-1133 or email cclc@lcclc.org.

JASMYN is working to respond to the COVID-19 virus while still remaining open to offer limited youth services. JASMYN encourages youth to check their website daily and before coming to the JASMYN campus because this information is likely to change. If you have questions the best way to connect with a JASMYN staff member is to email jasmyn@jasmyn.org. That email is being checked hourly (9:00 AM – 5:00 PM) and all inquiries are being sent to the appropriate staff member. JASMYN is also staffing the phone lines from 10:00 AM – 5:00 PM. They have staff working remotely answering the phone. If you need to speak directly with a staff member call: 904-389-3857 between 10:00 AM and 5:00 PM. Learn more about their current youth services on their website.
Their services are being held in-person and online. Check their social media and website for updates during COVID-19.
Trans Connect is offering services online until further notice. Get in touch to join: ankorstransconnect@gmail.com.
Their normal business hours have resumed, with a few restrictions: Maximum of 2 people in the library, wearing face covers is obligatory, you have to respect 2 meters distance between individuals.

Due to COVID-19, the Centre has closed their offices for the time being but remain virtually open to continue to provide settlement services, Language Instruction for Newcomers to Canada(LINC), careers services, and a variety of other services. Check their website for updates.

FCJ Refugee Centre continues to remotely offer their services, and you can connect with them by phone or e-mail. Their Migrant Workers Mobile Program & Anti-Human Trafficking Program is active: 647-971-2153 (Whatsapp also available). Check their social media and website for updates.
For emergencies, please contact 24/7 resources: Hotline 1-888-505-1010 / SOS Domestic Violence: 1-800-363-9010 / Suicide Action Montreal: 1-866-277-35

As of February 22, 2022 Kind Space will continue to require vaccination verification for all in-person meetings, groups, or events taking place at their location. The drop-in will re-open on September 26th. Evening groups, events, services, and rentals will continue as scheduled.

Most of SPECTRUM's groups and programming are once again happening in-person, some with the option to join virtually. Please check their calendar for the most up to date information: https://www.ourspectrum.com/events/

Due to the pandemic, they have adjusted their office hours, require physical distancing at the office, their van delivery service is pre-order only before 2pm on Tuesdays and Thursdays, and they are not taking back used sharps. See their social media or website for further details, and if you have any questions, reach out at 709-757-7927 (call) or 709-765-7927 (text).

Fenway Health appointments will now operate both in the form of telehealth and in person. They will continue to see patients in person when such a visit is necessary. Check their website for more information on changed clinic hours and other changes due to COVID-19: 
https://fenwayhealth.org/updates-to-fenway-health-services-in-response-to-covid-19
es:
Las citas de Fenway Salud (Fenway Health) ahora operarán tanto en forma de telesalud como en persona. Continuarán atendiendo a les pacientes en persona cuando dicha visita sea necesaria. Consulta su sitio web para obtener más información sobre el cambio de horario de la clínica y otros cambios debido a COVID-19:
https://fenwayhealth.org/updates-to-fenway-health-services-in-response-to-covid-19

en: Catholic Charities West Virginia is committed to staying present and working through the Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic with the vulnerable populations they serve. Visit https://catholiccharitieswv.org/covid-19-updates/ for more information.
es: Caridades Católicas de Virginia Occidental se compromete a permanecer presente y trabajar durante la pandemia del Coronavirus (COVID-19) con las poblaciones vulnerables a las que sirven. Visita https://catholiccharitieswv.org/covid-19-updates/ para obtener más información.

en: Mt. Vernon, Glen Burnie, and Randallstown centers are currently open Monday through Thursday, 8 a.m. to 8 p.m., and Friday 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Columbia Center will be open Monday to Friday, 8 a.m. to 5 p.m.
es: Los centros de Mt. Vernon, Glen Burnie y Randallstown están actualmente abiertos de lunes a jueves, de 8 a. m. a 8 p. m., y los viernes de 8 a. m. a 5 p. m. Columbia Center estará abierto de lunes a viernes de 8 a. m. a 5 p. m.

en: In response to the COVID-19 pandemic, Some of their services are online. Email info@outrightvt.org for a link to access the program meetings or check the calendar on their website.
Some locations may have different hours or be temporarily closed due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Check their website for more information.
es: Algunas ubicaciones pueden tener horarios diferentes o estar cerradas temporalmente debido a la pandemia de COVID-19. Chequea su sitio web para más información.

en: The Vermont Food bank and their network of partner food shelves and meal sites throughout the state have been on the front lines addressing the hunger crisis that has emerged as a part of the pandemic and associated economic recession. Please call the Food Shelf or Meal Site first to ensure they are open. If you are in need of help, please visit their coronavirus services for individuals page.
es: El banco de alimentos de Vermont y su red de estantes de alimentos asociados y sitios de comidas en todo el estado han estado en primera línea para abordar la crisis del hambre que surgió como parte de la pandemia y la recesión económica asociada. Llama primero al Estante de alimentos o al Sitio de comidas para asegurarte de que estén abiertos. Si necesitas ayuda, visita su página de servicios de coronavirus para individues.

en: Musa-Obregon Law PC remains open during the COVID-19 pandemic. Call or contact online to schedule a case evaluation.
es: Musa-Obregon Law PC permanece abierto durante la pandemia de COVID-19. Llama o póngate en contacto en línea para programar una evaluación de su caso.

en: Due to the pandemic, Feeding Chittenden are offering to-go meals and pre-packaged food.
es: Debido a la pandemia, Alimentando a Chittenden (Feeding Chittenden) ofrece comidas para llevar y alimentos preenvasados.

en: Visit their COVID-19 Update page for changes on how to file in your county, as well as other information: https://www.namechangeproject.org/covid-19-changes/
es: El Proyecto de cambio de nombre de Colorado brinda información y formularios sobre cómo actualizar su nombre y marcador de género en el estado de Colorado. Su objetivo es ayudarlo a comprender y navegar mejor el proceso de cambiar su nombre y/o su marcador de género. Han automatizado los formularios necesarios para un cambio de nombre de adulte y menor en Colorado y están trabajando en paquetes de formularios para su cambio de marcador de género. Nota: no se forma ninguna relación abogade-cliente simplemente usando este sitio, accediendo a la información contenida allí o usando los formularios proporcionados, toda la información se proporciona tal cual.

en: For the safety of their clients, staff and visitors, they are respecting social distance guidelines during the COVID19 pandemic. Accordingly, Bretz & Coven will be available via phone, email and Skype. If you are seeking a consultation,  use the live-chat option, call or email.
es: Por la seguridad de sus clientes, staff y visitantes, están respetando las pautas de distanciamiento social durante la pandemia del COVID-19. De acuerdo a esto, Bretz & Coven estarán disponibles vía telefónica, por correo electrónico y Skype. Si buscas una consulta, utiliza la opción de chat, llamada o teléfono.

en: Due to COVID, The Boston Alliance of LGBTQ+ Youth (BAGLY) has moved a majority of its programming online. In addition, The BAGLY Clinic is currently closed due to construction. They are no longer taking walk-in appointments at this time. You must make a virtual appointment before you can come in person. The Boy Lounge social group and Disabilities Meetings are on hold.
es: Debido a COVID, The Boston Alliance of LGBTQ+ Youth (BAGLY) ha trasladado la mayor parte de su programación en línea. Además, la Clínica BAGLY actualmente está cerrada debido a obras de construcción. Ya no están tomando citas sin cita en este momento. Debes hacer una cita virtual antes de poder venir en persona. El grupo social Boy Lounge y las Reuniones de Discapacidades están en espera.

en: YPI  reintroduced in-person programming at their drop-in space! They also offer virtual programs/support groups via Zoom and on Discord. They are currently redesigning their website.
es: ¡YPI reintrodujo la programación en persona en su espacio de acogida! También ofrecen programas virtuales/grupos de apoyo a través de Zoom y en Discord. Actualmente están rediseñando su sitio web.

en: In response to COVID-19, program recruitment and youth check-ins continue, and LAYC is serving youth and families through virtual academic, enrichment, wellness, mental health, and workforce programming, as well as safe in-person services such as safe housing support and STI and pregnancy testing.
es: Debido al Covid-19, el programa de contratación y registros de jóvenes continúan. LAYC sigue sirviendo a jóvenes y familias a través de programas académicos, de aprendizaje, bienestar, salud mental y empleabilidad de forma virtual. También ofreciendo servicios cara-a-cara como ayuda con alojamiento seguro y pruebas de ITS y de embarazo.

en:
Due to the COVID-19 public health emergency, select Sexual Health Clinic services are available on a walk-in basis to a limited number of patients each day. Patients can also call the NYC Sexual Health Clinic Hotline to speak with a Sexual Health Clinic health care provider

Patients of all ages with symptoms can be seen by a health care provider. At this time, they are offering walk-in STI and HIV testing only to people without symptoms who are 25 years and younger.
es: Debido a la emergencia de salud pública COVID-19, algunos servicios de la Clínica de salud sexual están disponibles en base a un número limitados de pacientes cada día. Los pacientes también pueden llamar a la Línea directa de la Clínica de salud sexual de Nueva York para hablar con un proveedor de servicios médicos de Clínica de salud sexual.

en: The Imperial Valley LGBT Resource Center remains open during the COVID-19 pandemic from 10:00- 17:00, but many of their services have moved to virtual. Call them for more information about HIV testing and counseling or 12-step recovery groups.
es: Debido a la pandemia del covid-19 Imperial Valley LGBT Resource Center abre de 10:00 - 17:00, pero muchos de sus servicios se realizan de forma virtual. Llama para mayor información sobre pruebas de VIH y orientación o para unirte a grupos de recuperación.

en: Boulder Valley Women’s Health Center is open and operating with some adjustments while taking extra precautions to ensure the safety of patients and staff. Their schedule is open to all types of appointments and services. Telehealth appointments will continue to be an option for some types of appointments; if interested in making a Telehealth appointment, call at 303-442-5160 or email at scheduling@bvwhc.org.
es: Boulder Valley Women’s Health Center esta abierto y en funcionamiento con algunos ajustes y precauciones adicionales para asegurar la seguridad de los pacientes y sus empleadxs. Los horarios están abiertos para todo tipo de citas y servicios. Servicios médicos a distancia (telemedicina) seguirán siendo una opción para algunos tipos de citas; si le interesa concertar una cita para servicios a distancia, llame a 303-442-5160 o envía un email a scheduling@bvwhc.org.

en: At this time, most of the services are being provided via telehealth.
es: En este momento, la mayoría de los servicios se brindan a través de telesalud.

en: Spectrum requires masks, temperature taken on arrival, and offers hand sanitizer for use upon arrival. If you have a fever or are displaying symptoms, Spectrum will help you make a doctor’s appointment and/or get tested. You are required to be cleared by a doctor or be symptom-free for 14 days before you may access the space. Please call ahead if possible to limit the number of people within the space. If you are not able to call ahead, feel free to stop by but please know you may have to wait outside. Spectrum will continue to offer youth all material resources that are available, and staff will be available for case management and crisis intervention by phone and conference calls.
es: Spectrum requiere máscaras, toma de temperatura a la llegada y ofrece desinfectante de manos para usar a la llegada. Si tienes fiebre o muestras síntomas, Spectrum te ayudará a programar una cita con el médico y/o hacerte la prueba. Debes obtener la autorización de une médique o estar libre de síntomas durante 14 días antes de poder acceder al espacio. Llama con anticipación si es posible para limitar la cantidad de personas dentro del espacio. Si no puedes llamar con anticipación, no dudes en pasar, pero ten en cuenta que es posible que tienes que esperar afuera. Spectrum seguirá ofreciendo a les jóvenes todos los recursos materiales disponibles, y el personal estará disponible para la gestión de casos y la intervención en crisis por teléfono y conferencias telefónicas.

en: In response to the COVID-19 pandemic, the majority of their services are virtual. Please check their website for updates.
es: En respuesta a la pandemia de COVID-19, la mayoría de sus servicios son virtuales. Consulta su sitio web para obtener actualizaciones.

en: In response to the evolving COVID-19 situation, CASP is providing their volunteers, staff, and guests with state and local guidelines, in Spanish and English, about in-person contact.
es: En respuesta a la evolución de la situación de COVID-19, CASP está brindando a sus voluntaries, personal e invitades pautas estatales y locales, en español e inglés, sobre el contacto en persona.

en: Due to the coronavirus pandemic, on-campus operations have been significantly reduced. Check their website for updates.
es: Debido a la pandemia de coronavirus, las operaciones en el campus se han reducido significativamente. Consulta su sitio web para obtener actualizaciones.

en: Due to the evolving situation with Covid-19 and the Omicron variant, please check the program calendar or contact via phone or email , if possible, before coming to Access Alliance.

Owing to the citywide need to lower the community spread of coronavirus, GLIDE has adjusted some of its operations to maintain essential services while protecting the health and safety of their clients, staff and the general public. For the latest updates click their website (www.glide.org/covid19). A detailed schedule of program operations is also available on their website.
es: Debido a la necesidad de diminuir la difusión comunal de coronavirus por la ciudad, GLIDE ha cambiado unos de sus operaciones para mantener servicios esenciales mientras proteger la salud y seguridad de sus clientes, empleadxs, y el público general. Para las últimas actualizaciones visita su sitio de web (www.glide.org/covid19). Un horario detallado de programas está disponible en su sitio de web también.

en: Because of the US Government’s cut back on the number of refugees admitted to the country and the high cost of living in San Francisco, the Guardian Group decided in May 2018 to suspend its regular meetings and work. They are responding and reacting to opportunities on an ad hoc basis and stand ready to resume “normal operations” if external conditions allow. Check their website for updates on activity.
es: Debido al recorte en el número de refugiadxs admitixs del gobierno EEUU y la cuesta alta de vivir en San Francisco, el Guardian Group decidió suspender sus reuniones y trabajos regulares en Mayo 2018. Ellos responden a oportunidades dependiendo de las circunstancias y están listos a resumir operaciones regulares cuando las condiciones externas lo permitan. Revisa su sitio de web para actualizaciones de actividad.

en: All of Haven House’s 11 programs have remained operational during the pandemic and are currently accepting referrals, although the majority of their staff is telecommuting. If you need help, please call their main office at 919-833-3312 between 9:00 AM – 3:00 PM. If you need assistance outside of these hours, please call Wrenn House at 919-832-7866.
es: Los 11 programas de Haven House han permanecido operativos durante la pandemia y actualmente aceptan referencias, aunque la mayoría de su personal trabaja a distancia. Si necesitas ayuda, llama a su oficina principal al 919-833-3312 entre las 9:00 a. m. y las 3:00 p. m. Si necesitas ayuda fuera de este horario, llame a Wrenn House al 919-832-7866.

en: All programs are currently held in person. Masks are required and other safety protocols are in place. All programs have a hybrid option.

COVID-19 Advisory: Visitor restrictions are in place for all Phoenix Children’s locations. Masks are required for all visitors and for patients ages 2+. For more information, visit the COVID-19 Resource Center (https://phoenixchildrens.org/COVID-19-Resource-Center).
Visit their website (www.phoenixchildrens.org/crewsn-healthmobile) for more information and clinic schedule. Call ahead (602-933-9339) to make an appointment.
es: Aviso de COVID-19: solo un cuidador principal puede acompañar a un paciente en todos los lugares. Se requieren máscaras para visitantes y pacientes mayores de 2 años. Para obtener más información, visite el Centro de recursos de COVID-19 (https://phoenixchildrens.org/COVID-19-Resource-Center).

en:
In compliance with Alameda County the Pacific Center's facility at 2712 Telegraph Ave remains closed. This is in a continued effort to reduce the risk of exposure and keep the community safe. 

While their building remains closed and all in person on-site and off-site meetings have been canceled, Pacific Center has transitioned most of their services to an online format. They are now providing video/teleconferencing for therapy sessions, peer group meetings and therapy groups. Please check their website for more information. The BOLD Program is currently on hold. Please check the calendar for changes to service holds. Some 12 Step meeting groups are also on hold.
es: Por el momento, el Pacific Center permanecerá cerrado hasta el 06/01/2021. Esto es en servicio de unos esfuerzos de minimizar el riesgo de exposición de nuestra comunidad y mantenerla segura.

en:
Now that widespread vaccination is available, The Gender Pathways Clinic at Kaiser Permanente San Francisco Medical Center's communities are starting to return to pre-pandemic activities. It’s important to understand that COVID-19 is still present and still poses a risk, especially to those who aren’t vaccinated.

To get information about other locations, online care (e-visit), or to schedule a phone or video visit, or use the mobile app, visit kp.org, or call 866-454-8855 (TTY 711). Visit the website for more information: https://mydoctor.kaiserpermanente.org/covid-19
es: Durante COVID-19, el acceso a centros médicos, hospitales, y departamentos de emergencia de Kaiser Permanente está limitado solamente a pacientes y cuidadores esenciales. También, Kaiser Permanente ha cerrado temporalmente unas oficinas médicas selectas.

en: Beginning July 13, 2020, the Center will offer in-person services on a limited, by-appointment basis. Staff on a staggered work schedule will be on-site Monday through Friday from noon to 5 PM until further notice. As of March 3, 2021, we began offering dedicated drop-in service times for specific initiatives and activities, so long as capacity limits and other safety measures are followed. Please see their website for more information: https://lgbtbrooklyn.org/coronavirus/
es: A partir del 13 de julio de 2020, el Centro ofrecerá servicios en persona con cita limitada. El personal en un horario de trabajo escalonado estará en el lugar de lunes a viernes de mediodía a 5 PM hasta nuevo aviso. Para obtener más información, visite su sitio web: https://lgbtbrooklyn.org/coronavirus/

en: In response to the global pandemic, they are supporting the community with virtual/online community spaces. Please email info@weareoutintheopen.org with any questions.
es: En respuesta a la pandemia global, están apoyando a la comunidad con espacios comunitarios virtuales/en línea. Envía un correo electrónico a info@weareoutintheopen.org si tienes alguna pregunta.

en: ***Needs to confirm LGBTQ+ Affirming***
es: ***Se necesita confirmar Afirmación a personas LGBTQ+***

en: ***Needs to confirm LGBTQ+ Affirming***
es: ***Necesita confirmar Afirmación LGBTQ+***

en: The Pride Center of WNY has begun reintroducing small group meetings and rolling out in-person services, they will continue virtual services and have plans to expand offerings to ensure that LGBTQ people are getting the support they need. Visit the link to learn about their COVID-19 response. http://www.pridecenterwny.org/GetInvolved/VisitUs

Amid the COVID-19 pandemic, Family Equality is providing spaces for you and your family to connect with others, find support, and build community through a Facebook group, various family activities, and other opportunities. All educational events and recurring support groups are taking place virtually until further notice.
es: Durante la pandemia de COVID-19, Family Equality provee espacios para ti y tu familia para conectar con otros, encontrar apoyo y construir comunidad por un grupo de Facebook, actividades familiares variadas, y otras oportunidades. Todos los eventos educativos y grupos de apoyo recurrentes tienen lugar virtualmente hasta nuevo aviso.

en: BPL branches are now open and offering services, although some programs are still currently virtual. Masks are required for both patrons and staff. Check their website for updates: www.bklynlibrary.org/coronavirus
es: Las sucursales BPL seleccionadas están abiertas ahora con servicio limitado. Aunque algunos están cerrados, alientan a los usuarios a utilizar sus recursos digitales. Se requieren máscaras tanto para los clientes como para el personal. Visita su sitio web para actualizaciones: www.bklynlibrary.org/coronavirus

en: If you think you may have COVID-19, you can get care quickly through the MyMountSinai app. If you do not have COVID-19, but want to schedule a routine doctor's appointment, you can set up a video visit easily through MyChart (www.mountsinai.org/appointment/mychart). If you need more information, call Mount Sinai or your care provider. Masks are still required in health care facilities, per New York State.
es: Mount Sinai lo hace más fácil - y más seguro - recibir atención médica. Si piensas que puedes tener COVID-19, puedes recibir atención rápidamente por sus servicios de video y en línea por Mount Sinai Now Virtual Care (www.mountsinai.org/care/mount-sinai-now). Como resultado de la pandemia, visitas rutinarias con médicos primarios se reprograman o se ofrecen como visitas por video. Si no tienes COVID-19 pero quieres fijar una cita médica rutinaria, puedes fijarlo fácilmente por MyChart (www.mountsinai.org/appointment/mychart). Si necesitas más información, llama a su médico primario.

en: Masks are required and visitors must show proof of full vaccination or a negative PCR test.
The BFC is now open for in-person appointments!
es: ¡El BFC ya está abierto para citas en persona!

en: During COVID-19, SCO programs are operating as normal with a few exceptions. Check their website for details: https://sco.org/covid-19
es: Durante COVID-19, programas de SCO operan como normal con unas excepciones. Chequea su sitio de web para detalles: https://sco.org/covid-19

en: For inquiries on COVID-19 precautions please email probono@cabaprobono.com.

At the present time, online appointments are not available.
You must come in person to their offices for services. Clients will be served on a first come, first served basis.
es:
En este momento, las citas en línea no están disponibles.
Debes venir en persona a sus oficinas para recibir servicios. Les clientes serán atendides por orden de llegada.

en: Jewish Community Services of South Florida (JCS) continues to serve the community during the coronavirus outbreak. During this unprecedented time, JCS remains open, providing food, counseling, crisis response and information, and referral services. For assistance, call 2-1-1 or 305-576-6550. As one of the leading human services providers in Miami-Dade County, JCS is working around the clock to support you during this time of need. Visit their website for updates and more information.

Due to COVID-19, Broward Legal Aid's building is closed to the public.
However, they are still here to help you with your legal needs. 
Please call 954-765-8950 for assistance.

Due to overwhelming case load and insufficient resources, the immigration unit is experiencing a backlog of 6 to 8 weeks to schedule a consultation and are NOT accepting asylum applications at the moment.
es:
Debido al COVID-19, el edificio de Broward Legal Aid está cerrado al público.
Sin embargo, todavía están aquí para ayudarte con tus necesidades legales.
Llama al 954-765-8950 para obtener ayuda.

Debido a la abrumadora cantidad de casos y la insuficiencia de recursos, la unidad de inmigración está experimentando un retraso de 6 a 8 semanas para programar una consulta y NO está aceptando solicitudes de asilo en este momento.

en: CHN is offering telehealth visits and limited in-person appointments. Call for more information (866-246-8259).
es: CHN está siguiendo de cerca las directrices de los Centros para el Control de Enfermedades (CDC) y del estado y la ciudad de NY para proporcionar el ambiente más seguro posible. Se ofrecen visitas en persona limitadas y visitas de Telehealth/video para pacientes. CHN proporciona atención médica de alta calidad y sin juicio, sin tener en cuenta la raza, la religión, la orientación, la identidad de género, el estado migratorio o la capacidad de pago. No dan vuelta a nadie lejos. CHN ofrece servicios LGBTQ y un Refugee Health Program.

en: Due to the current state of emergency related to the coronavirus, HEAT is temporarily suspending all community-based activities. This includes all previously announced large scale HEAT events such as our Paint Party, Skate Party, and House Ballroom activities. They plan to reschedule these events at a future date when it is safe. Their clinic will remain open and they are available to answer your questions or concerns by phone at (718) 613-8453. With regard to appointments, they are asking that only clients with immediate concerns come in person to avoid any inadvertent exposure to coronavirus. Check their website for updates.
es: Debido al estado actual de emergencia relacionado con el coronavirus, HEAT está suspendiendo temporalmente todas las actividades comunitarias. Esto incluye todos los eventos de HEAT a gran escala previamente anunciados, tales como nuestra fiesta de la pintura, fiesta del skate, y actividades del salón de baile de la casa. Planean reprogramar estos eventos en una fecha futura cuando sea seguro. Su clínica permanecerá abierta y estarán disponibles para responder sus preguntas o inquietudes por teléfono al (718) 613-8453. Con respecto a las citas, piden que solo los clientes con preocupaciones inmediatas vengan en persona para evitar cualquier exposición involuntaria al coronavirus. Visita su sitio web para obtener actualizaciones.

en: Worship services can be presented on-line only via Zoom and on Facebook. For a link, email: information@fuub.org
es: Los servicios de adoración se presentarán en línea sólo a través de Zoom y en Facebook. Para un enlace, envía un correo electrónico a: information@fuub.org

en: Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, Central American Legal Assistance (CALA) are currently not offering walk in services. Please call their office at 718-486-6800 between Monday - Friday 10 AM - 4 PM.
es: Para ayudar a conservar tanto tu salud como la de ellos, la oficina de CALA está limitando sus actividades. Por el momento no atienden sin previa cita. Llama a la oficina de lunes a viernes, de 10am a 4pm para coordinadar una consulta telefónica. Por favor ten a la mano el número de caso si aplica.

en:
Due to COVID-19, their shipments are still extremely delayed. They are unable to process and mail many binders and femme shapewear garments at a time, which has increased their waiting times. Some international shipments are still suspended/not allowed.

You may make a request online, and they will continue to operate on a first-come, first-served basis, but they unfortunately cannot offer any estimates on when you will receive your garment.

Their volunteer team will be monitoring the situation closely to get their programs back in action as soon as they may safely do so. Please continue to follow all guidelines for remaining safe and healthy. Check their website for updates.
es:
Debido a COVID-19, los envíos están extremamente retrasadas. No pueden tramitar y enviar muchos binders de pecho y prendas modeladores a la vez, que ha aumentado el tiempo de espera. Unos envíos internacionales están suspendidos o no permitidos. 

Puedes pedir en línea, y continuarán a operar por orden de llegada, pero desafortunadamente no pueden ofrecer ningunas estimaciones de cuando recibirás tu prenda.

Debido a COVID-19, los envíos están extremamente retrasadas. No se pueden tramitar o enviar muchos binders de pecho y prendas modeladores a la vez, lo cual ha aumentado el tiempo de espera. Algunos envíos internacionales están suspendidos o no permitidos. 

Puedes hacer pedidos en línea, y continuaran a operar por orden de llegada, pero desafortunadamente no pueden ofrecer ninguna estimado de cuando recibirás tu prenda.

Su equipo voluntario observa la situación para reactivar los programas tan pronto como puedan hacerlo seguramente. Por favor continúa siguiendo todas las directrices para mantenerte segurx y sanx. Chequea su sitio de web para actualizaciones.

en: As a provider of essential services, AAFSC remains open during the ongoing COVID-19 emergency in New York. They have worked with city and state agencies to move their services to confidential teleconferencing arrangements and remote learning schedules to continue safely serving their vulnerable immigrant and refugee clients. AAFSC has created comprehensive COVID-19 guides in English, Arabic, Bangla, and Urdu that provides information on how to access resources aimed at supporting New Yorkers during the coronavirus outbreak, including housing assistance, food assistance, and healthcare navigation. Visit their website here for more information on COVID-19 services: https://www.aafscny.org/covid-19/
es: Como proveedor de servicios esenciales, AAFSC permanece abierta durante la emergencia en curso del COVID-19 en Nueva York. Han trabajado con agencias de la ciudad y del estado para trasladar sus servicios a arreglos confidenciales de teleconferencia y horarios de aprendizaje remoto para continuar sirviendo de manera segura a sus clientxs inmigrantes y refugiadxs vulnerables. La AAFSC ha creado guías completas de COVID-19 en inglés, árabe, bangla y urdu que proporcionan información sobre cómo acceder a recursos destinados a apoyar a lxs neoyorquinxs durante el brote de coronavirus, incluyendo asistencia en vivienda, asistencia alimentaria y navegación en salud. Visite su sitio web aquí para obtener más información sobre los servicios de COVID-19: https://www.aafscny.org/covid-19/

en: Their firm is fully operational remotely and use the latest technology to ensure that their staff and attorneys can continue to work on cases and answer any questions and provide the same top level quality services to their clients.
COVID-19 UPDATE: The center's building is open- masks are strongly encouraged; many services are available remotely
es: El Borderland Rainbow Center está operando actualmente en línea durante la pandemia de COVID-19. Visita su página de Facebook en https://www.facebook.com/borderlandrainbowcenter/para el grupo de apoyo y oportunidades de terapia. El horario temporal de su despensa de alimentos es los lunes de 10:00 AM a 2:00 PM.

en: Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, most refugee hearings at the Immigration and Refugee Board – Refugee Protection Division (IRB-RPD) are being held virtually on Microsoft Teams.

They are open for telehealth services (phone appointments) and extremely limited physical appointments when deemed absolutely necessary by their doctors. They are not taking drop-in appointments. They are unable to provide routine screenings (STI and Pap), but can provide prescriptions over the phone if you are symptomatic or in need of birth control by appointment. The best way to book is to call 579-1009 or toll free 1-877-NOMYTHS.

Due to COVID-19, the immigration consultations with their attorney will be made only by phone or video/chat. The attorney is available every Friday from 10 am to 1 pm. The free Literacy Initiative will also be held virtually.
es: Debido al COVID-19, las consultas de inmigración con su abogade se realizarán únicamente por teléfono o video/chat. El abogado está disponible todos los viernes de 10 am a 1 pm. La Iniciativa de Alfabetización gratuita también se llevará a cabo de manera virtual.

en:
Appointments are required (all appointments that do not require a face mask will be in-person. Other appointments will be held virtually over the phone). If you are experiencing an emergency, you should go to the emergency department. If you are having difficulty breathing or experiencing other severe symptoms, like fever, cough, difficulty breathing, muscle aches, fatigue, headache, sore throat, runny nose call Sanctuary at 226-336-1321 or Telehealth Ontario at 1-866-797-0000. 
Walk-ins are limited. Call Sanctuary at 226-336-1321 in order to not have to waited outside. Privacy of appointment information sent to sanctuaryrefugee@gmail.com (or use other electronic means) cannot be guaranteed.

Rosie’s Place’s doors remain open during COVID-19 to offer housing, treatment, and food services to women in need. Responding to COVID-19, they have incorporated social distancing throughout each service they provide.
es: Las puertas de Rosie’s Place permanecen abiertas durante COVID-19 para ofrecer servicios de vivienda, tratamiento y alimentación a mujeres necesitadas. En respuesta a COVID-19, han incorporado el distanciamiento social en cada servicio que brindan.

en: COVID-19 health and safety screening measures are in place. Pre-screening and masks are required for entry.
The public office is currently closed to the public due to the COVID-19 pandemic. To make an appointment, call 505-247-1023.
es: La oficina pública está actualmente cerrada al público debido a la pandemia de COVID-19. Para hacer una cita, llama al 505-247-1023.

en: Dade Legal Aid services are available online and by telephonic intake from 8:30 am – 4:00 pm Monday – Friday. Existing clients may contact your attorney or their secretary directly for assistance at 305-579-5733 or email them between the hours of 8:30 am – 4 pm. New clients may apply online or by phone at the numbers below.  If you have an emergency and need immediate assistance dial 911.
The Black Coalition for AIDS Prevention is Open. Their services are available virtually and by phone. The physical office is closed to the public.

During COVID-19, EBSC ​​is doing everything it can to support members of the immigrant community in need of its support. Walk-in hours have been suspended, but a hotline is available for any questions about the resources available to immigrants during COVID-19.
es: Con la escalada rápida de COVID-19, EBSC hace todo lo posible para apoyar a los miembros de la comunidad inmigrante que necesitan su apoyo. Las horas sin cita han sido suspendidas, pero una línea directa está disponible para cualquier pregunta sobre los recursos disponibles para los inmigrantes durante COVID-19.

en: To ensure continued access to birth control and other essential sexual and reproductive health services during the COVID-19 pandemic, Maine Family Planning is using Telehealth technology to connect with patients from a distance. Visit their website for more information: https://mainefamilyplanning.org/virtual-visits-hub
es: Para garantizar el acceso continuo al control de la natalidad y otros servicios esenciales de salud sexual y reproductiva durante la pandemia de COVID-19, Planificación familiar de Maine está utilizando la tecnología de telesalud para conectarse con les pacientes a distancia. Visite su sitio web para obtener más información: https://mainefamilyplanning.org/virtual-visits-hub

en: Due to COVID-19 regulations, CCJM requests that individuals do not come in-person without first having an appointment. They recommend wearing a mask when coming to the office. If you are under arrest or detained, call the Provincial Telephone Guard Service at 1-800-842-2213.
Remote working protocols are in place, there will be limited in person meetings. For service: Call 416-533-8545, E-mail info@spanishservices.org, MONDAY to FRIDAY 9:00 am to 5:00 pm ET.

Starting December 19, 2020, they resumed modified in-person services with new safety features. In-person services will be provided by appointment only, which must be scheduled by phone, email, or text at least 24 hours in advance. They will continue delivering educational services and health promotion workshops virtually.

For the health and safety of Hope House residents and Hope Acts staff & volunteers, they ask to make an appointment before going to the office. 
Hope House English Language Program (HHELP) – Remote English classes continue on a rolling basis.
Work Permit Form Assistance is offered by appointment only on Wednesday afternoons.
es:
Por la salud y la seguridad de les residentes de Casa de Esperanza(Hope House) y del personal y les voluntaries de Actos de Esperanza(Hope Acts), piden hacer una cita antes de ir a la oficina.
Programa de idioma inglés Hope House (HHELP): las clases remotas de inglés continúan de forma continua.
La asistencia con el formulario de permiso de trabajo se ofrece con cita previa solo los miércoles por la tarde.

en: Due to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, all services and events are currently being conducted virtually
All events are in-person. Information and scheduling details can be found on their website
es: Todos los eventos son presenciales. La información y los detalles de la programación se pueden encontrar en su sitio web.

en:
In response to the COVID-19 pandemic, and consistent with Alberta Health Services recommendations, the End of the Rainbow Foundation is only offering group meetings via Zoom to help slow the rate of COVID-19 infections. PLEASE CHECK WITH GROUP EMAILS TO REGISTER BEFORE ATTENDING.

They plan to resume in-person groups when it becomes possible. They will continue to provide support to anyone that requests it, however, visit the group or service page (https://endoftherainbow.ca/support/) and email the associated service. Volunteers are able to provide support remotely through email, phone calls, and video conferencing. If you require one-to-one support, then please request this and they can arrange safe meetings upon request. They will monitor the changing situation and provide updates as necessary.
Trinity Church has reopened for their 11:15am Sunday Holy Eucharist. Proof of vaccination for all who are eligible to be vaccinated (all those age 5 and up) is required for any in-person events.
es: Trinity Church ha reabierto para su Santa Eucaristía dominical a las 11:15 am. Se requiere prueba de vacunación para todos los que son elegibles para ser vacunados (todos los mayores de 5 años) para cualquier evento en persona.

en: Please see official scholarship website for application deadlines
es: Por favor, consulte el sitio web oficial de becas para conocer los plazos de solicitud

en: Project Renewal is at the front lines of New York City’s response to COVID-19. Currently, they are: Providing health care at their four shelter-based clinics, three mobile medical vans, and through their expanded tele-psychiatry and tele-health systems; Housing over 2,000 New Yorkers in seven emergency shelters, five transitional homes, and eight permanent supportive buildings; and Preparing and delivering meals for over 2,500 homeless New Yorkers daily. Check their website for updates.
es: Project Renewal está en las trincheras de la respuesta a COVID-19 de la ciudad de New York. Actualmente, provee atención médica en sus cuatro clínicas basadas en albergues, tres camionetas médicas móviles, y por sus sistemas telefónicos expandidos de psiquiatría y salud; provee alojamiento a más que 2.000 neoyorquinxs en siete albergues de emergencia, cinco casas de transición, y ocho edificios de viviendas permanentes de apoyo; y prepara y entrega comidas a más que 2.500 neoyorquinxs sin vivienda diariamente. Chequea su sitio de web para actualizaciones.

en: The Family Justice Centers (FJC's) are open and providing free services and confidential assistance by phone and in person. For in person services, you can call the Family Justice Center to make an appointment or walk into your nearest FJC if you cannot engage in remote services safely or effectively. For remote services, you can call 311 or the phone numbers listed below to be connected to your nearest FJC. If you are asked and it is safe to do so, please leave us a message and someone will get back to you.
es: Los edificios de NYC Family Justice Center están temporalmente cerrados como parte de la respuesta de la Ciudad a COVID-19. Los servicios y apoyos para los sobrevivientes siguen disponibles por teléfono. Llama al 311 para estar conectado con el NYC Family Justice Center más cercano.

en:
Given the risk of spreading the coronavirus (COVID-19), Dans la rue informs the public that the following measures have been implemented in order to continue to offer select services while reducing the risk to homeless youth, staff, volunteers and partners:

Mandatory handwashing, frequent disinfection of surfaces and physical distancing rules are in effect at all their facilities.
Mask must be worn at all times.

The Ali Forney Center will remain open during COVID-19. For LGBTQ+ youth experiencing the terrors of homelessness, the Center are their first responders. The Center is continuing to provide emergency shelter, transitional living, and transgender housing and care programs, case management, mental health services, and medical services. Drop-in services have been moved to a smaller location to promote social distancing, but street homeless clients can access crisis intervention, meals, mental health services, housing referrals, and other services in person or by phone. In-person services currently offered in Manhattan. Call 212-222-3427 for their main headquarters, and call 212-206-0574 for the Harlem drop-in center which is staffed 24/7. For more information, visit this link: https://www.aliforneycenter.org/covid-19-response/
es: El Ali Forney Center permanecerá abierto durante COVID-19. Para jóvenes LGBT que experimentan los terrores de la falta de vivienda, el Center es su principal respuesta. El Center continúa a proveer albergue de emergencia, viviendas de transición, y alojamiento transgénero y programas de cuidado, servicios de salud mental, y servicios médicos. Servicios sin previa cita han sido movidos a sitios más pequeños para promover la distancia social, pero clientes sin hogar en la calle pueden acceder a intervención de crisis, comidas, servicios de salud mental, referencias para alojamiento, y otros servicios en persona o por teléfono. Servicios en persona se ofrecen en Manhattan actualmente. Llama 212-222-3427 para su oficina central, y llama 212-206-0574 para el Drop-In Center de Harlem que se dota de personal las 24 horas del día, los 7 días de la semana. Para más información, visita el enlace: https://www.aliforneycenter.org/covid-19-response/

en: Due to COVID-19, BDS’ physical offices are open by appointment only. Current clients of BDS should contact their lawyer, social worker, or other staff for an appointment. Individuals who are not current clients and need assistance should visit their website (https://bds.org/get-help).
es: Debido a la emergencia actual relacionada con el COVID-19 las oficinas físicas de Brooklyn Defender Services están cerradas a visitantes hasta nuevo aviso. Su staff está trabajando y continuará presente en la corte para atender ingresos, comparecencias y emergencias. Para recursos y servicios disponibles, visita la guía COVID-19 Resource Guide en su sitio web. Para más información: http://bds.org/about/covid-19-informacion

en: Beginning Saturday, June 11, Green Chimneys’ Farm & Wildlife Center in Brewster will resume public access on Saturdays and Sundays from 10am-3pm.
es: De acuerdo con las recomendaciones de las agencias estatales y las autoridades sanitarias locales, Green Chimneys está cerrada al público.

en: The Portland office is usually open Monday-Friday from 9:00 am – 16:00 pm. However, because of COVID, it sometimes isn’t staffed. Please call before coming to be sure someone will be there to receive you: 207-871-7437. Extension 1 for English, and then Extension 0 for Reception.
All groups are now meeting virtually on Zoom.
es: Todos los grupos ahora se están reuniendo virtualmente en Zoom.

en: Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, some groups may not be currently meeting in person. In addition, many of the group meetings now have a virtual option to join. Contact them at (859) 797-8352 or email officemanager@lexpridecenter.org to check on current options.
The Clinic has moved to Minneapolis and is no longer seeing patients in St. Paul. The new address is 1919 Nicollet Ave, Minneapolis MN.
es: La Clínica se mudó a Minneapolis y ya no atiende pacientes en St. Paul. La nueva dirección es 1919 Nicollet Ave, Minneapolis MN. Se mudaron el 23 de noviembre de 2021.

en: In response to COVID-19, SJC staff will be working remotely as long as feasibly possible with remote clinics. SJC is currently not holding in-person consultations. However, SJC is offering free phone consultations between 9 am - 5 pm Monday through Thursday. SJC is also providing accessible technology for their employees to help meet clients where they are.
es: En respuesta a COVID-19, el personal del SJC trabajará a distancia tanto tiempo como sea posible con clínicas remotas. SJC actualmente no tiene consultas en persona. Sin embargo, SJC ofrece consultas gratuitas entre las 9 am - 5 pm de lunes a jueves.

en: Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, ISAC is experiencing a significant increase in requests for assistance.  As a result, it is taking staff longer than normal to return calls and respond to referrals.

Services are available by phone (502-322-4036) 
Monday-Thursday: 10am-6pm
es:
Los servicios están disponibles por teléfono (502-322-4036)
Lunes-Jueves: 10am-6pm

en: The Food Bank is committed to making sure all neighbors have access to enough food during the COVID-19 (coronavirus) crisis. For more information on how you can get food, please visit the 'Get Help' page here: https://www.pittsburghfoodbank.org/get-help/ OR call the concierge line at 412-460-3663 ext. 655.
Dreams of Hope is hosting virtual events during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Due to COVID-19 all classes now have an online option. Many tutors continue to meet with students virtually. In-person tutoring has resumed at the discretion of the tutor and student groups. Follow the link to learn more: https://www.literacypittsburgh.org/news/covid-update/
All Goodwill stores within the Southwestern Pennsylvania network are currently open. Check website for mask guidelines and store hours.

During the COVID-19 outbreak, Casa San José  is continuing to keep their community informed with up to date information in Spanish about COVID-19, available resources and more. Check their website and social media for updates.
Pittsburgh Mercy is continuing to serve patients during the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic.
In person services are once again open. However, virtual services are still offered.
es: Todos los servicios de alabanza serán en línea hasta nuevo aviso. Las reuniones en persona están suspendidas. Los servicios de despensa y refugio permanecen abiertos. Revisa sus redes sociales para actualizaciones.

en: New Alternatives is continuing to provide services during the COVID-19 pandemic. Check their social media (www.facebook.com/NewAlternatives) for updates.
es: New Alternatives continúa brindando servicios durante la pandemia de COVID-19. Consulte sus redes sociales (www.facebook.com/NewAlternatives) para obtener actualizaciones.  Sus principios rectores son los de la reducción de daños, el desarrollo de los jóvenes y el empoderamiento. Las nuevas alternativas ayudan principalmente a los jóvenes LGBTQ y a los adultos jóvenes que tienen entre 16 y 30 años de edad y sin hogar o en riesgo. Definen la falta de vivienda en general para incluir la vida en la calle, la estancia en un refugio o con un programa de vida de transición, o la falta de vivienda permanente.

en: Surgical ear loop masks, at a minimum, must be worn within all AHN facilities.  Cloth face masks are no longer permitted, as they do not provide the best level of protection against Coronavirus.

La Casa de las Madres is following guidelines from the CDC and the San Francisco Department of Public Health to ensure the health and safety of its clients, volunteers, and employees. They have re-opened the Drop-In Center Monday-Friday from 9:00AM - 4:30PM. Appointments aren't necessary but it is best to arrive by 3:00PM as intakes may take time. All visitors are required to wear masks, go through a symptom screen and have their temperatures checked before meeting with staff members. All services are open and active. Please note that their text line (415-200-3575) is not confidential and that, at this time, it is not staffed 24 hours a day. If you need an immediate response, please reach out by phone to the hotline number.
es: La Casa de las Madres sigue las pautas de los CDC y el Departamento de Salud Pública de San Francisco para garantizar la salud y la seguridad de sus clientes, voluntaries y empleades. Han vuelto a abrir el Centro de acogida de lunes a viernes de 9:00 a. m. a 4:30 p. m. Las citas no son necesarias, pero es mejor llegar a las 3:00 p. m., ya que las admisiones pueden llevar tiempo. Todes les visitantes deben usar máscaras, pasar por una evaluación de síntomas y controlar sus temperaturas antes de reunirse con los miembros del personal. Todos los servicios están abiertos y activos. Ten en cuenta que su línea de texto (415-200-3575) no es confidencial y que, en este momento, no cuenta con personal las 24 horas del día. Si necesitas una respuesta inmediata, comunícate por teléfono al número de la línea directa.
