en: Pillars Community Health continues to operate during the COVID-19 pandemic. All programs and services, including in-person, curbside, and Telehealth services in Medical and Dental; COVID-19 testing and vaccinations; virtual behavioral health visits with some in-person appointments; 24-hour crisis services; resources for area schools; shelter services and medical and legal advocacy for domestic and sexual violence survivors, and more. Before visiting an office/clinic, if you are sick, experiencing symptoms of COVID-19, or have been exposed to someone who tested positive for COVID-19, please call Pillars (708-745-5277). Depending on your symptoms, they may suggest a telehealth visit. Masks or face coverings are required in all Pillars Community Health spaces.Temperature and wellness checks will be conducted for all staff and visitors at the entrance of all Pillars Community Health office locations. Remember to maintain social distancing during your visit.
es: Pillars Salud Comunitaria (Pillars Community Health) continúa operando durante la pandemia de COVID-19. Todos los programas y servicios, incluidos los servicios en persona, en la acera y de telesalud en servicios médicos y dentales; Pruebas y vacunas de COVID-19; visitas virtuales de salud del comportamiento con algunas citas en persona; servicios de crisis las 24 horas; recursos para las escuelas del área; servicios de refugio y defensa médica y legal para sobrevivientes de violencia doméstica y sexual, y más. Antes de visitar una oficina/clínica, si está enfermo, experimenta síntomas de COVID-19 o ha estado expuesto a alguien que dio positivo por COVID-19, llama a Pillars (708-745-5277). Dependiendo de tus síntomas, pueden sugerirte una visita de telesalud. Se requieren máscaras o cubiertas faciales en todos los espacios de Pillars Salud Comunitaria. Se realizarán controles de temperatura y bienestar para todo el personal y les visitantes en la entrada de todas las oficinas de Pillars Salud Comunitaria. Recuerda mantener el distanciamiento social durante tu visita.

en: Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, CAPASITS has implemented strict health protocols and requires beneficiaries to schedule an appointment via phone prior to receiving service.
es: Debido a la pandemia del COVID-19, CAPASITS ha implementado estrictos protocolos de salud y requiere que los beneficiarios agenden una cita por teléfono antes de recibir servicios.

en: Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, La Casa de la Sal, A.C. requires beneficiaries to schedule an appointment in order to receive any services.
es: Debido a la pandemia del COVID-19, La Casa de la Sal, A.C.  pide que las personas beneficiarias agenden una cita previa para poder recibir cualquiera de los servicios.

en: The office hours provided are an approximation. Housing is given based on the home's capacity.
es: Las horas de oficina son una aproximación. Alojamiento se da dependiendo de la capacidad disponible dentro de la casa.

en: During the crisis caused by the Covid-19 coronavirus, we are meeting weekly via an online conference using the ZOOM app. Wednesdays, 8:30pm, https://zoom.us/j/6191599777
es: Durante la crisis provocado por la COVID-19 coronavirus, nos reunimos semanalmente por medio de una conferencia en línea usando la aplicación de ZOOM. Miercoles, 8:30pm, https://zoom.us/j/6191599777

en:
As of 10/24/2021: 

In-Person Shopping is open Monday – Friday 1:00 – 4:00 and Tuesday 5:00 – 7:00 pm. Come and pick out your own meat, produce, dairy, and nonperishable items. Masks are required inside Gallatin Valley Food Bank. Not comfortable coming inside? Give a call ahead of time or let a staff member know and a box will be packed.
es:
A partir del 24/10/2021:

Las compras en persona están abiertas de lunes a viernes de 1:00 p. m. a 4:00 p. m. y martes de 5:00 p. m. a 7:00 p. m. Venga y elija su propia carne, productos agrícolas, productos lácteos y artículos no perecederos. Se requieren máscaras dentro del Banco de Alimentos de Valle de Gallatin. ¿No te sientes cómode entrando? Llama con anticipación o informe a une miembre del personal y se empacará una caja.

en: A number of services are altered during the Covid-19 pandemic. See each service for more information.
Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, certain services may be altered or made virtual. Contact the organization for further information.
es: Debido a la pandemia de COVID-19, ciertos servicios pueden modificarse o volverse virtuales. Contacta con la organización para más información.

en:
The Condesa clinic will only open files based on installed capacity. Users who exceed this capacity will do so at the Condesa Iztapalapa Clinic.

Counseling and Diagnostic services will remain universal. However, patients with a recent diagnosis and social security will be referred to the corresponding institution for their care.

Appointments will be based on installed capacity and will not necessarily be the same day.
es:
La clínica Condesa abrirá únicamente expedientes con base en la capacidad instalada. Los usuarios que rebasen esta capacidad lo harán en la Clínica Condesa Iztapalapa. 

Los servicios de Consejería y Diagnóstico seguirán siendo universales. Sin embargo, los pacientes con diagnóstico reciente y seguridad social serán referidos a la institución que corresponda para su atención. 

Las citas se darán con base en la capacidad instalada y no necesariamente serán el mismo día.

en: WLS continues to provide legal aid services at this time. According to CDC guidelines they are not taking walk-ins at this time. In-person appointments may be available. To access services during normal business hours, which are Monday through Friday from 9:00 a.m. to 17:00 p.m., call 775-329-2727.
es: WLS continúa brindando servicios de asistencia legal en este momento. De acuerdo con las pautas de los CDC, no están aceptando visitas sin cita previa en este momento. Las citas en persona pueden estar disponibles. Para acceder a los servicios durante el horario normal de atención, que es de lunes a viernes de 9:00 a. m. a 17:00 p. m., llame al 775-329-2727.

en: Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the INM office in Quintana Roo has put sanitary measures in place, in accordance with federal and state regulations. The number of individuals allowed in the building is limited, and people requesting services must practice social distancing and wear a mask. Hand sanitizer is also provided in the building.
es: Debido a la pandemia del COVID-19, la oficina del INM en Quintana Roo ha implementado medidas sanitarias, de acuerdo con las regulaciones federales y estatales. El número de personas permitidas dentro del edificio es limitado, y las personas que soliciten servicios deben utilizar cubrebocas. También hay estaciones de gel antibacterial dentro del edificio.

en: Suited for Change recognizes that the women they serve are most directly impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic and so they continue to provide their important services to the community.
es: Liste para el cambio reconoce que las mujeres a las que sirven son las más directamente afectadas por la pandemia de COVID-19 y, por lo tanto, continúan brindando sus importantes servicios a la comunidad.

en: DC Affordable Law Firm continues to operate during the COVID-19 pandemic.
es: El bufete de abogades asequible de DC continúa operando durante la pandemia de COVID-19.

en: LGBTQ Counseling continues to operate during the COVID-19 pandemic; some providers may offer both in-person and online therapy appointments.
es: La consejería LGBTQ continúa operando durante la pandemia de COVID-19; algunos proveedores pueden ofrecer citas de terapia tanto en persona como en línea.

en: Many services are adapted during the covid-19 pandemic. See each service for more details.
Due to COVID-19, before any service is offered, the person should reach out on the phone to have a consultation before.
es: Debido al COVID-19, quien desee ser atendido deberá comunicarse por teléfono para tener una consulta antes de acudir.

en: Masks are still required for their services. All clinic locations are still screening for symptoms of COVID-19. Every Friday, HPC hosts a No Cost COVID Vaccination Clinic for children (six months and older) and adults from 5 to 6 p.m. at the Olathe clinic, 407 S. Clairborne Rd., Ste. 104, Olathe, Kan. 66062. The clinic is open to the community. Appointments are required. To schedule an appointment, please call 913-648-2266. The clinic offers First, Second and First/Second Booster doses of Pfizer and Moderna. If you have it, please bring an I.D. card, proof of address, insurance card and COVID record card.
es: Todavía se requieren máscaras para sus servicios. Todas las ubicaciones de las clínicas todavía están evaluando los síntomas de COVID-19. Todas las ubicaciones de las clínicas ofrecen vacunas COVID sin costo los martes y jueves desde el mediodía hasta las 3 p.m. con cita previa para cualquier persona mayor de 12 años.

en: The service is for men +18 years old only (including members of LGBTQ+ group)
es: El servicio solo es para hombres mayores de 18 años (incluyendo miembros de la comunidad LGBTQ+)

en: Before obtaining shelter, clients must quarantine at a nearby hotel first. Due to the COVID-19 pandemic there is limited space thus it is advised to call them first.
es: Antes de obtener refugio, los clientes deben hacer cuarentena en un hotel cercano. Debido a la pandemia por COVID-19, el espacio es limitado, por lo que se recomienda llamar primero.

en: The pantry is annual, the enrollment process starts each January
es: La despensa es anual, el proceso de inscripción inicia cada enero

en:
Information about COVID-19 vaccines - https://www.nevadahealthcenters.org/c19vaccine/
All visitors are screened for COVID-19 symptoms. Virtual care options are available.
es:
Información sobre las vacunas COVID-19: https://www.nevadahealthcenters.org/c19vaccine/
Todes les visitantes son examinades para detectar síntomas de COVID-19. Las opciones de atención virtual están disponibles.

en: Tenants may still face immediate eviction if they don’t respond to eviction notices, despite the extension of the CDC moratorium. If you have received an eviction notice or order, please visit the Civil Law Self-Help Center ASAP on the first floor of the Regional Justice Center at 200 Lewis Ave downtown. Other tenants with questions can connect with a legal advocate by calling 702-386-1070 or by emailing info@lacsn.org.
es: Lxs inquilinxs aun podrán enfrentar desalojamiento forzado si no responden a los aviso de desalojo, sin importar la extensión de la moratoria de la CDC. Si has recibido un aviso u orden de desalojo, por favor visita el Centro de Autoayuda de Derecho Civil ASAP en el primer piso del centro de justicia regional en 200 Lewis Ave downtown. Otrxs arrendatarixs con preguntas pueden conectarse con un/a/x defensor/a/x legal llamando al 702-386-1070 o por correo electrónico a  info@lacsn.org.

en: The Billings Height location is temporarily closed due to construction. Contact Billings West for assistance.
es: La ubicación de Billings Height está temporalmente cerrada debido a la construcción. Póngase en contacto con Billings West para obtener ayuda.

en: Capital Clubhouse, Inc. continues to operate during the COVID-19 pandemic and meets daily virtually.
es: Capital Clubhouse, Inc. continúa operando durante la pandemia de COVID-19 y se reúne virtualmente todos los días.

en: Pride Center San Antonio continues to operate throughout the COVID-19 pandemic.

Due to COVID-19, all physical offices are closed for walk-in appointments. Call the Intake Hotline or fill out the intake form online. Follow this link for COVID resources: https://www.legalaidhawaii.org/covid-19-legal-help.html.
es: Debido a COVID-19, todas las oficinas físicas están cerradas para citas sin cita previa. Llame a la línea directa de admisión o complete el formulario de admisión en línea.

en: During the COVID-19 pandemic, all meals are provided to-go.
es: Durante la pandemia de COVID-19, todas las comidas se proporcionan para llevar.

en: Due to COVID-19 our hours of operation have been modified.
es: Debido al COVID-19 nuestro horario de atención ha sido modificado.

en: Due to COVID-19, the Community Center is currently closed to the public. All support groups are online. Identity Health Clinic will continue honoring office appointments for labs, vitals and limited exams. Telehealth appointments will be arranged for all other visits.
es: Debido a COVID-19, el Centro Comunitario actualmente está cerrado al público. Todos los grupos de apoyo están en línea. Identity Health Clinic continuará cumpliendo con las citas de la oficina para análisis de laboratorio, signos vitales y exámenes limitados. Se programarán citas de telesalud para todas las demás visitas.

en: They are still offering services virtually during the COVID-19 pandemic.
es: Todavía están ofreciendo servicios virtualmente durante la pandemia de COVID-19.

en: Although SCVAN and their legal department is working remotely due to COVID-19, they continue to serve crime victims. If you or someone you know need assistance, please call 803-509-6552 or submit an online intake and they will get back to you as soon as possible.
es: Aunque SCVAN y su departamento legal están trabajando de forma remota debido al COVID-19, continúan sirviendo a las víctimas de delitos. Si tu o alguien que conoces necesita ayuda, llama al 803-509-6552 o envía una solicitud en línea y se comunicarán contigo lo antes posible.

en: Due to Covid-19 restrictions, most appointments are now handled by phone until further notice

Services are currently online due to COVID-19. The only services currently being offered are: virtual social groups through Zoom and a free clothing drive. The hours are currently different and are dependent on the calendar of services found on the website.
es: Los servicios están actualmente en línea debido a COVID-19. Los únicos servicios que se ofrecen actualmente son: grupos sociales virtuales a través de Zoom y una colecta de ropa gratis. Actualmente, los horarios son diferentes y dependen del calendario de servicios que se encuentra en el sitio web.

en: Starting October 2022, Ward 4 Mutual Aid is only open one week per month.
es: A partir de octubre de 2022, Ayuda Mutua del Distrito 4 (Ward 4 Mutual Aid) solo abre una semana al mes.

en: Community of Hope is not able to directly place families and individuals into any of their programs. They can provide assistance to access other local resources and programs. For more information, please contact their Bellevue Family Success Center.
es: Comunidad de Esperanza (Community of Hope) no puede ubicar directamente a familias e individues en ninguno de sus programas. Pueden brindar asistencia para acceder a otros recursos y programas locales. Para obtener más información, comunícate con su Centro de Éxito Familiar de Bellevue.

en: Francis Food Pantry will only offer a drive-thru or walk-up services. For your safety, there will be no walk-in services.

Respond Now WILL continue to provide pantry services Mondays thru Fridays from 10:00 AM - 4:30 PM. Their staff will greet you outside at your car or on the sidewalk to determine what your needs are and provide you with pre-packaged groceries and any information about resources that you may need. They respectfully request that you maintain a 6-7ft distance if you come on foot. If you are currently in need of housing services please contact the Suburban Cook Homelessness Prevention Hotline at (877) 426-6515. *They will not be taking walk-ins of any kind at this time.*
es: Responde ahora CONTINUARÁ brindando servicios de despensa de lunes a viernes de 10:00 a. m. a 4:30 p. m. Su personal lo recibirá afuera en su automóvil o en la acera para determinar cuáles son tus necesidades y brindarle alimentos preempacados y cualquier información sobre los recursos que puedas necesitar. Te solicitan respetuosamente que mantengas una distancia de 6 a 7 pies si vienes a pie. Si actualmente necesitas servicios de vivienda, comunícate con la línea directa de prevención de personas sin hogar de Suburban Cook al (877) 426-6515. *No aceptarán visitas sin cita previa de ningún tipo en este momento.*

en: Community Servings continues to deliver meal services through the pandemic.
es: Servicios Comunitarios (Community Servings) continúa brindando servicios de comidas durante la pandemia.

en: The Brookline Food Rescue continues to provide services during the COVID-19 pandemic.
es: Brookline Food Rescue continúa brindando servicios durante la pandemia de COVID-19.

en: GLAD Answers are unable to answer phone calls live at this time. Please leave a voicemail with your name and contact information and they will get back to you within three business days. For a quicker response, reach out by email.
es: GLAD Answers no puede responder llamadas telefónicas en vivo en este momento. Deja un mensaje de voz con tu nombre e información de contacto y se comunicarán contigo dentro de los tres días hábiles. Para una respuesta más rápida, comunícate por correo electrónico.

en: Cherokee Health Systems is offering COVID-19 vaccines daily at all clinics. For more information, please contact CHS at 1-866-231-4477.
es: Sistemas de Salud Cherokee ofrece vacunas COVID-19 diariamente en todas las clínicas. Para obtener más información, comunícate con CHS al 1-866-231-4477.

en: Please be advised that Willowdale Community Legal Services is limiting face to face meetings as a result of COVID-19.  They encourage telephone, email and video conference assistance when possible and masks are required for in-person service.

MCC Toronto is offering Services in various formats including online, in-person, and hybrid. Registration is required to attend modified in-person Services. Please check the website for registration details and updates.
Most of the services continue remotely to reduce risks to staff and clients.

COVID-19 Alert Masks are Required: VSC's office is open 9 AM - 5 PM Monday through Friday.  Reentry and case management services appointments and walk-ins are accepted. Please call 202-544-2131 for more information and to schedule an appointment.
Some services have gone virtual due to COVID-19.

The Pride Link will be back with drop-in hours soon. They are working on improvements to our programs to make it more effective for you all. Once they reopen, providers will be on-site delivering various services to remove barriers to care, build trust between LGBTQ+ folks and service providers, and make sure you get the care you need to live a happy, healthy, and whole life. Check out some of their services on-site and find out more by viewing their online calendar.

Immigration legal services In-person hours of operation have resumed. Please see below for exceptions:
Greenville: Monday and Wednesday 8am-5pm
Berea: Monday and Tuesday, 8am-5pm 
Orientations are available via Zoom in all locations.
es:
Se han reanudado los servicios legales de inmigración en persona. Consulta a continuación las excepciones:
Greenville: lunes y miércoles de 8 a. m. a 5 p. m.
Berea: Lunes y Martes, 8am-5pm
Las orientaciones están disponibles a través de Zoom en todas las ubicaciones.

en: All services are by appointment only. Please call 865-215-5081 for HIV Care. Please call 865-215-5371 for Sexually Transmitted Infections (STI) and Tuberculosis (TB).
es: Todos los servicios son solo con cita previa. Llama al 865-215-5081 para atención del VIH. Por favor llama al 865-215-5371 para Infecciones de Transmisión Sexual (ITS) y Tuberculosis (TB).

en: Tailored for Success continues to operate during the COVID-19 pandemic.
There is no set time/location for this organization, it is starting up and they advise that you follow them on Facebook to keep up with their services.
es: No hay una hora / ubicación establecida para esta organización, se está iniciando y te aconsejan que los sigas en Facebook para estar al día con sus servicios.

en: Graves and Doyle is still available for scheduled consultations and assisting detained individuals during the COVID-19 pandemic. All consultations will be conducted remotely until further notice; they will work with you to find an option that works for you. To arrange a consultation, please phone 617-542-6400.

Thrive is currently open and operating at its regular hours. It offers in-person services as well as remote telehealth services for those who do not feel comfortable with in-person meetings due to COVID-19.

Greater Chicago Legal Clinic remains open and continues to help low-income residents of Greater Chicago with their legal needs during this public health emergency. Our physical office has reopened at 17 North State Street, Suite 1710, but some Clinic attorneys are still working remotely.
As of March 2020, due to COVID-19, do not visit the help desk locations until further notice. Please call or apply for services online.

Rian continues to work remotely. If you would like to schedule a consultation or are looking for counseling or resources please call 617-542-7654. To see their COVID-19 updates visit https://www.riancenter.org/what/covid-19/
Tennessee Justice for Our Neighbors is working by appointment only. For assistance, please call or text in Spanish or English at (615) 538-7481.
es: Justicia de Tennessee para nuestros vecines (Tennessee Justice for Our Neighbors) está trabajando solo con cita previa. Para obtener ayuda, llama o envía un mensaje de texto en español o inglés al (615) 538-7481.

en: They offer telehealth and in-person appointments. For in-person appointments please wear a cloth face covering. If you have a fever, cough or shortness of breath, call your health center to reschedule your appointment.
es: Ofrecen telesalud y citas en persona. Para citas en persona, use una cubierta de tela para la cara. Si tienes fiebre, tos o dificultad para respirar llama a tu centro de salud para reprogramar tu cita.

en: Due to ongoing public health concerns, Hawaii LGBT Legacy Foundation is open by appointment only.  Please contact Tatiana Kalaniʻōpua Young at Tatiana@HawaiiLGBTlegacy.com for more information.

TNLR are monitoring recommendations of the World Health Organization and the Massachusetts Department of Public Health, and making decisions that are grounded in preserving the safety of survivors, staff, volunteers, and the community at large. With this in mind they have suspended their in-person services for the time being, but their hotline and other services remain open. Visit the link to learn more on their COVID-19 protocols: https://www.tnlr.org/en/coronavirus/

Nashville CARES is partnering with the State of TN to provide free OraQuick In-Home HIV Testing Kits upon request. This new alternative testing option is in response to the COVID-19 crisis our community and country is currently battling.

For more information on OraQuick In-Home HIV Testing Kits, please contact Lisa Binkley, Associate Director of Prevention and Education at (615) 761-4474.
es:
Nashville CARES se está asociando con el estado de TN para proporcionar kits gratuitos de prueba de VIH en el hogar OraQuick a pedido. Esta nueva opción de prueba alternativa es en respuesta a la crisis de COVID-19 que nuestra comunidad y nuestro país están luchando actualmente.

Para obtener más información sobre los kits de prueba de VIH en el hogar OraQuick, comunícate con Lisa Binkley, directora asociada de prevención y educación al (615) 761-4474.

en: In order to keep Bridge youth, staff and the greater community safe, Bridge is responding to the growing threat of the COVID-19 Delta Variant with sustained tenacity.  Symptom screening and contactless temperature checks are implemented for youth arriving at Bridge. Mask wearing is required across Bridge locations, regardless of vaccination status. See more information on their COVID-19 response here : https://www.bridgeotw.org/covid19

For everyone’s safety, masks are still required at all times while at Waimānalo Health Center. While the Hawai‘i indoor mask requirement is ending on March 25, masks are still recommended indoors at health care facilities. Mahalo for your kōkua and understanding.

Their top priority is to ensure the safety of their supporters and community members. They ask that individuals who may have been exposed or have chronic medical conditions to take precautions recommended by the CDC.

HHHRC is suspending all walk-in services except for current clients, and is not accepting new patients
or referrals at this time (with the exception of newly diagnosed HIV+ individuals). See their website for more info.

In response to this updated guidance and low COVID-19 case rates, the wearing of masks will now be optional at PGC and all of its locations. The following precautions will still be taken: temperature checks will still be required for entry; masks are optional in all places except for common areas; continue proper hand hygiene; social distancing as needed. Avoid congregating.

In response to COVID-19 and to ensure safe interactions, Catholic Charities Hawai'i is offering its counseling services online and by phone. For more information or to schedule an appointment please call 808-520-7721
es: En respuesta al COVID-19 y para garantizar interacciones seguras, Catholic Charities Hawai’i  está ofreciendo sus servicios de orientación online y por teléfono. Para mayor información o para programar una cita por favor llama al 808-520-7721

Due to the ongoing pandemic, the Legal Clinic is serving the community primarily by phone and email. In-person appointments will be scheduled if a caseworker determines it is necessary. The Clinic is closed to walk in visitors. Please contact the Legal Clinic by phone or email to discuss your legal issue: 519-821-2100 or 1-800-628-9205 or gwlegalclinic@lao.on.ca. They will respond to messages within 48 business hours. Please indicate If you have any urgent deadlines as messages are screened and triaged and urgent matters are dealt with in priority sequence. TEF is currently experiencing an unusually extreme increase in requests for assistance this summer. Unfortunately this is forcing them to put a pause on all services except food assistance and personal supply assistance until further notice. Given the barriers of their budget, they are only able to provide $100,000 annually towards rental and utilities assistance. They are already close to that threshold. If you have already applied, they will be in touch soon about your assistance application. They will not be accepting any new applications at this time.

es: Queer YEG en sí no tiene empleadxs o socios/as y no es una fuente directa para preguntas relacionadas con la comunidad LGBT+. Right now, lawmakers all across the South are passing extreme legislation banning best-practice medical care for transgender youth. As a result, 75% of transgender youth in the South now live in a state where a ban on gender affirming care has passed. In response, the Campaign for Southern Equality has launched the Southern Trans Youth Emergency Project (STYEP), a new regional effort which provides rapid response support directly to the families of youth who are impacted by anti-transgender healthcare bans in the South.

An Update on Gender-affirming Hormone Therapy in Florida: Plume is quickly ramping up efforts to comply with new laws in Florida (SB254). Members will need to meet with a doctor (an MD or DO), in-person, and sign an informed consent form created by the Florida Boards of Medicine and Osteopathic Medicine. After this initial in-person visit, they can provide additional care and prescription refills online.

They have partnered with TransFamily Support Services to offer care to folx who can't afford their sliding scale fee. Scholarship based care funding will be prioritized for members of our community with multiple barriers to gender affirming care such as marginalization due to race, income, rural location, and/or disability. Applications are currently closed. QueerDoc will reopen the application once more funding is available. Follow them on social media to find out when the scholarship reopens.

Brave Space is undergoing a large structural change to how they do business. During this time, they are operating under limited capacity, and have had to make some difficult choices on areas where they need to pare back their services. For the time being, they have made the difficult decision to pause their front desk services and close their waitlist in order to focus care on their staff and their current clientele. They will not be scheduling new intakes or letter-writing appointments at this time.

OHSU COVID-19 pandemic response: Visitors: As of Sept. 12, 2022, most patients can have 2 visitors at a time (1 visitor for adult surgery and procedure areas). Hours for visiting most adult patients are 5 a.m. to 9 p.m. Masks: Oregon no longer requires masks in health care settings. At OHSU, they still require masks for ages 2 and older: In areas where patients and staff are at greatest risk; By patient request; Based on guidance from the CDC.
OHSU respects all who choose to wear masks, at any time and in any setting. The reasons to wear a mask may be very personal. They expect all OHSU members, patients and visitors to respect this choice. OHSU strongly recommends mask-wearing throughout their health care system, including at OHSU hospitals and clinics, Hillsboro Medical Center and Adventist Health Portland. OHSU highly recommends all patients wear masks when outside their room.

Due to COVID-19, the SAGA team is still evaluating the safety of in-person meetings. At this time, SAGA meetings remain virtual. Zoom invites are given out by request and through their private Facebook group and discord server.
Their office is conveniently located in Cincinnati, in the Madisonville area. Can’t make it into the office? No worries – they've got you covered with teletherapy.

Sterling, Cynthiana, Covington, Florence, Louisville, Jeffersonville IN, Bardstown, London, Morehead. Please note that at this time, the closest birthing center is Tree of Life in Jeffersonville, IN where she does accept clients.

Due to the Coronavirus (COVID-19) health emergency, they have limited in-person hours. Their hours for 2023 are:
Monday: By appointment only​. Tuesday: 10am-2pm. Wednesday: 10am-4pm. Thursday: 10am-2pm.

The TransLatin@ Coalition continues to provide critical services to (TGI) during the COVID-19 pandemic. They have implemented both telehealth, social distancing, and other safety measures to ensure that both (TGI) people accessing their services and their staff are safe. During this time their Drop-in space has restricted access. However, they continue to provide daily warm meals from 12:30 to 2 pm.

They encourage folks to call their main line to make an appointment at 1-833-TG SAFE-1 (1-833-847-2331) but walk-ins are also welcome. Face masks, and body temperature measures and brief verbal health questionnaire are required to enter their facilities.

While some of their legislators have shown ignorance and cowardice, they prefer to focus on the people who matter most to them: the trans youth who are the future. While the outcome of the legislation still remains uncertain pending lawsuits from outside parties, including the ACLU, they stand with and value trans youth as always. Please don't let this setback dim your light.

If you need emergency contraception (AKA the morning after pill), you can walk in anytime they’re open.

You are welcome to walk in any time the Health Center is open to make an appointment or see if there is a same day appointment available. If you have the time to wait, they will make every effort to fit you in the same day. If they can’t see you, they will give you the first priority appointment available.

Pregnancy tests are available on a walk-in basis from the time they open until one hour before closing.

BTTF provides $7500+ in funding to up to 150 Black trans women per month via our bi-weekly ride sponsorship program. Each woman can request up to $50 per application. 

Please wait at least 72 hours for applications for ride funding to be processed.
Only one application will be accepted for ride funding per person within a two week period.
Please make sure all personal and payment information is filled out correctly, or your request for funding can not be approved. Each applicant is eligible to receive funding for a passport one time in a 5 year period.
Please note that submitting an application does not guarantee funding. Funding is dispersed upon availability and applicant identity verification.
